http://www.lsoft.com/images/listserv-community.gif http://www.lsoft.com/images/listserv_small.gif AUA-PARTNERSHIPS List AUA-PARTNERSHIPS List Archives https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk/cgi-bin/webadmin?RSS&L=AUA-PARTNERSHIPS&v=ATOM1.0
This is an Atom formatted XML site feed. It is intended to be viewed in a Newsreader. Alternatively you can view the HTML archives at https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk/cgi-bin/webadmin?A0=AUA-PARTNERSHIPS.
LISTSERV Web Interface 2.4.1 2015-03-11T16:36:37Z Wendy Muir 2015-03-11T16:36:32+00:00 2015-03-11T16:36:32+00:00 Re: Double Degrees - China https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=AUA-PARTNERSHIPS;2142601e.1503 Hi Clare<br><br>I attended the British Council Services for International Education Marketing Conference in December. A number of sessions were given by Jeremy Chan, Head of Research and Consultancy for East Asia, British Council. One of his session was on TNE in China. In his presentation for that session, he said that the number of 3+1 or 4+0 TNE programmes in China has increased in recent years as MoE preference is to keep Chinese students at home and reverse flow of outward mobility. [...] Georgina Margaret Randall 2015-03-11T09:30:59+00:00 2015-03-11T09:30:59+00:00 Re: Double Degrees - China https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=AUA-PARTNERSHIPS;939e4638.1503 Hi Clare<br>We offer one programme that is modelled on a 2+2 and leads to an award of both UoR and the Chinese partner. It's been running for several years and is quite successful for us in terms of recruitment numbers.<br><br>It's really interesting to know you're hearing this might be a preferred model because we keep hearing the opposite! Although as I'm sure everyone finds, this sort of information can be very difficult to corroborate. We understand that the market is moving more towards flying faculty models - where Chinese students do not travel to the UK but complete [...] Clare McVeigh 2015-03-09T14:35:59+00:00 2015-03-09T14:35:59+00:00 Double Degrees - China https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=AUA-PARTNERSHIPS;1cc10885.1503 Dear all<br><br>Hoping to pick your collective brains! I was recently at an internal event here at Queen's to discuss opportunities in the Chinese market. It was suggested that potential partners were increasingly interested in developing proposals for double degrees at undergraduate level through 2+2 arrangements (two years at home with articulation to Level 2 and 3 study in the UK leading to awards by both institutions). Have any of your institutions engaged in such arrangements? If so, I would welcome any thoughts, pointers or comments. [...] Charles, Emma 2015-02-05T10:02:21+00:00 2015-02-05T10:02:21+00:00 unsubscribe https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=AUA-PARTNERSHIPS;a412a2eb.1502 Please can you remove me from this mailing list?<br><br>Emma Charles<br>Management Trainee<br>Campus Services<br><br>Email: emma.charles1@imperial.ac.uk<mailto:emma.charles1@imperial.ac.uk><br>Telephone: 020 7594 6767<br><br>www.imperial.ac.uk<http://www.imperial.ac.uk/> Phil.Berry 2015-02-05T10:09:43+00:00 2015-02-05T10:09:43+00:00 Re: Validation Team vacancies at the OU https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=AUA-PARTNERSHIPS;1d7622b6.1502 Apologies but it's been pointed out the link is going to an OU internal site - this is the public link for the vacancies - http://www3.open.ac.uk/employment/job-details.asp?id=8380&ref=ext<br><br>The jobs are open to external candidates.<br><br>Thanks<br><br>Phil Phil.Berry 2015-02-05T09:45:23+00:00 2015-02-05T09:45:23+00:00 Validation Team vacancies at the OU https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=AUA-PARTNERSHIPS;c74beb41.1502 Dear all,<br><br>Following some staffing changes we are looking to recruit two Quality and Partnership Managers (QPMs) to the Validation Team in the Centre for Inclusion and Collaborative Partnerships at The Open University. The new appointees will join a team of eight QPMs managing 28 validated partners.<br><br>More details of the role can be found on the OU vacancies website (http://intranet.open.ac.uk/employment/job-details.asp?id=8380&ref=ext) and details of our current validation activity can be found here - http://www.open.ac.uk/about/inclusion-and-curriculum/validation-partnerships [...] Clare McVeigh 2014-11-04T15:12:00+00:00 2014-11-04T15:12:00+00:00 Re: HE Progression Routes from Foundation Degree study https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=AUA-PARTNERSHIPS;677969cf.1411 Dear all<br><br>My sincere thanks to those members who responded to my earlier query regarding progression from Foundation Degree programmes. See below a summary of the responses received.<br><br>Best wishes<br><br>Clare<br><br>HEI<br><br>Progression Options<br><br>Plymouth University/City of Bristol College<br><br>Progression to Level 5 or 6 of appropriate undergraduate degree programme on successful completion of Foundation Degree study. [...] Hannah Jones 2014-10-23T17:04:04+01:00 2014-10-23T17:04:04+01:00 Degree classifications for Social Work https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=AUA-PARTNERSHIPS;62f5408.1410 Hello<br><br>How do other HEIs and FECs calculate the final degree mark for their BA (Hons) Social Work programmes? We are resisting being pushed into a position where we will have to include only the Levels 5 & 6 as this would mean 2/3 of the final mark would be based on the dissertation alone, that being the only academically-assessed piece of work in Level 6 with the placement being assessed against SOPs and a 'pass/fail' assignment.<br>Please reply to Guy at glangton@ruskin.ac.uk<mailto:glangton@ruskin.ac.uk> [...] Julia Forrest 2014-10-22T16:49:19+01:00 2014-10-22T16:49:19+01:00 Guidance for assessment, second-marking and moderation in partner provision https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=AUA-PARTNERSHIPS;612c4e55.1410 Hello All<br><br>We are reviewing the guidelines for assessment, marking and moderation<br>developed in relation to partner provision. The current model we use is to<br>begin new provision by second marking and moderating a significant<br>proportion of assessments produced from a partner provider. The proportion<br>of second marking and moderation carried out each year is relative to the<br>age of the partnership so that new partners, or new partner provision, has<br>a high proportion of assessment second-marked and moderated by University<br>staff (which can be quite a large amount in some cases and requires a lot<br>of staff time and [...] Anne Craven 2014-10-13T17:20:16+01:00 2014-10-13T17:20:16+01:00 Reminder -- AUA Partnerships Conference -- questions for the panel? https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=AUA-PARTNERSHIPS;c46d621f.1410 Dear All<br><br>Just a reminder that the AUA Partnerships Network one-day conference will<br>now take place in Manchester this coming Friday -- please see<br>http://www.aua.ac.uk/event-100-Partnerships-Conference.html for more<br>details.<br><br>Could I at the same time please ask if anyone would have any burning<br>questions for the afternoon's Panel Discussion? If so, please email them to<br>me -- I will then look into presenting them to the panel as appropriate and<br>then providing summary answers here on the list afterwards on the basis of<br>the panel's answers and reflections. [...] Clare McVeigh 2014-09-22T15:29:46+00:00 2014-09-22T15:29:46+00:00 HE Progression Routes from Foundation Degree study https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=AUA-PARTNERSHIPS;bf3cffcd.1409 Dear all<br><br>I'm attempting to undertake some benchmarking around current practice within the sector regarding progression from Foundation Degree (FD) study to Bachelor's level. To this end, I would be grateful if members could advise on normal practice within their respective institutions as to whether students who successfully complete a FD (for which their institution is the awarding body) are automatically entitled to progress to further study or if any specific entry requirements are applied (e.g. an elevated average mark for year 2 study), particularly where full-time places may be limited. [...] AUA ALL 2014-09-11T08:34:13+00:00 2014-09-11T08:34:13+00:00 Bookings are now open for the AUA Partnerships Conference: 17 October 2014 https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=AUA-PARTNERSHIPS;25662e2e.1409 AUA logo<http://www.aua.ac.uk/><br><br>Partnerships Conference<http://www.aua.ac.uk/event-74-Yorkshire-and-North-East-Conference.html><br>The Partnerships Journey<br><br>17 October 2014, Manchester<http://www.aua.ac.uk/event-74-Yorkshire-and-North-East-Conference.html> Conference Centre<br><br>Whether we realise it or not our working lives revolve around partnerships. From working with our colleagues to students, from collaborations with other institutions to external companies, the way we work with other people and organisations can have an impact both on a personal level and across an entire institution. [...] AUA ALL 2014-09-04T15:59:37+00:00 2014-09-04T15:59:37+00:00 AUA Annual Conference and Exhibition 2015 call for sessions: Just one week left! https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=AUA-PARTNERSHIPS;925597a0.1409 [AUA logo]<http://www.aua.ac.uk/><br><br>Annual<http://www.aua.ac.uk/event-69-Midlands-Conference.html> Conference and Exhibition:<br>Call for proposals<br><br>'Disruption, Diversity and Devolution'<br><br>30 March - 1 April 2015, Nottingham Trent University<br><br>There's just one week left to submit your session proposal for the AUA Annual Conference and Exhibition!<br>A fixture of the higher education calendar for more than 40 years, the AUA Annual Conference and Exhibition is the largest of its kind in the UK.<br>The Conference returns to Nottingham, one of the UK's most dynamic cities, steeped in rich cultural, industrial, scientific and sporting heritage. The Nottingham Conference Centre at Nottingham Trent University is a recently transformed Grade [...] Gillian Duncan 2014-08-06T11:08:21+01:00 2014-08-06T11:08:21+01:00 Re: FW: Dual degrees https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=AUA-PARTNERSHIPS;16cfec56.1408 Dear Sheila<br><br>St Andrews runs a double masters in 'sustainable energy' with MGIMO in<br>Russia.<br><br>One year in St Andrews and one year in Moscow. Here is the link to the<br>programme which is easier than me trying to explain it.<br>http://www.st-andrews.ac.uk/gsd/courses/pgt/sd/<br><br>Hope it helps.<br><br>Kind regards<br>Gillian<br><br>On 6 August 2014 10:50, Sheila Mills <sheila.mills@stir.ac.uk> wrote:<br><br>> Dear Sheila<br>><br>><br>><br>> The Academic Registrar here at Stirling forwarded me your email and I<br>> would be happy to share what we do at Stirling. We have one double degree at Masters level with a European institution and there are a couple of others being explored.<br><br>The model we have used with our current partner is summarised below: [...] Anne Craven 2014-07-31T00:27:22+01:00 2014-07-31T00:27:22+01:00 Recent Meeting & Successful Bid for One-Day Conference https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=AUA-PARTNERSHIPS;f6615efb.1407 Dear All<br><br>Many, many thanks to all those who attended the AUA Partnerships 're-launch<br>meeting' at Northampton last Friday, 25 July. More information on the<br>programme may be posted there as we go, over this week, so please keep<br>looking at the link if you are interested in coming!<br><br>If you need a car parking space please let me have your car registration<br>number and I will then liaise with Security. [...] Anne Craven 2014-07-11T21:19:59+01:00 2014-07-11T21:19:59+01:00 Partnerships Networking Day 25 July: PLEASE ENROL HERE https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=AUA-PARTNERSHIPS;928c3fb7.1407 Dear All<br><br>I have now gone through the answers and 25 July was the winner date.
